dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I’m finding this a very stressful working environment. Aunt Lucy said--

dialogues.speaker: KNUCKLES
dialogues.text: Aunt Lucy! I’ve had it up to here with Aunt Lucy! She sounds like a proper old bag to me. Paddington slowly turns his head towards Knuckles.

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON
dialogues.text: I beg your pardon?  Post Additional Photography Draft 2 - 06.08.17 53.

dialogues.speaker: KNUCKLES
dialogues.text: I said, your Aunt Lucy sounds like the most naive, gullible, mushy- brained... What’s going on? Paddington is giving Knuckles a HARD STARE. It is having remarkable effect, bringing him out in a cold sweat. KNUCKLES (CONT’D) What are you looking at me like that for? It’s awful hot in here. Are you hot? I’m hot. Did I leave the oven on?

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON
dialogues.text: It’s called a Hard Stare. Aunt Lucy taught me to do them when people have forgotten their manners.

dialogues.speaker: KNUCKLES
dialogues.text: You don’t need to tell me about hard stares, I practically invented them. Pretty good for a bear though, I'll give you that.

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON
dialogues.text: Now Mr McGinty, I may look like a hardened criminal to you, but I really am innocent. And if you’re not going to help me clear my name, you could at least help me make this marmalade!

dialogues.speaker: KNUCKLES
dialogues.text: Alright, I'll help. I doubt I’1l be much use to you though. (holding up his fists) These weren’t exactly made for cooking.

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON
dialogues.text: Oh I don’t know. Looks to me like you've got yourself a great pair of orange squeezers.

dialogues.speaker: KNUCKLES
dialogues.text: Orange squeezers? Paddington and Knuckles start to make marmalade. The came circles them, jumping forward each time it passes a pilla - Paddington selects the oranges from a pile while Knuckl squeezes them dry, not even chopping them in half. - Paddington and Knuckles stand at chopping boards, armed with knives and a pile of orange peels.  Post Additional Photography Draft 2 - 06.08.17 54.

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON
dialogues.text: Now we have to be very careful with knives. Aunt Lucy said that sensible bears... Knuckles eviscerates dozens of peels at machine-gun speed PADDINGTON (CONT’D) Where on earth did you learn to use a knife like that?

dialogues.speaker: KNUCKLES
dialogues.text: You don’t want to know.

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON
dialogues.text: Well it’s jolly good! - Next, Paddington stirs the mixture while Knuckles tips the rind. They’re starting to work together.

dialogues.speaker: KNUCKLES
dialogues.text: Now?

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON
dialogues.text: Now! - We move closer, circling around the BUBBLING, AMBER LIQ as they add sugar, cinnamon, chilli and lemon, Knuckles becoming involved in the creative process. PADDINGTON (CONT’D) Time for the sugar. That’s what turns the juice into marmalade.

dialogues.speaker: KNUCKLES
dialogues.text: How much?

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON
dialogues.text: A lot. Same again. A squeeze of lemon, a pinch of cinnamon, and just a bit more sugar. - Paddington pours in another huge amount of sugar. Knuck is surprisingly eager to know how they’ve got on.

dialogues.speaker: KNUCKLES
dialogues.text: Well? Is it good?

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON
dialogues.text: It’s too soon to tell. We’ll only really know when it’s set. 78 EXT. ST. PAUL’S CATHEDRAL - MORNING Judy, Jonathan and Mary hurry in behind a TOUR GROUP.  Post Additional Photography Draft 2 - 06.08.17 55.

dialogues.speaker: TOUR GUIDE
dialogues.text: Designed by Sir Christopher Wren, St. Paul’s Cathedral is one of London’s most famous landmarks... 79 INT. ST. PAUL’S CATHEDRAL - MORNING The Tour Guide continues as they walk in.

dialogues.speaker: TOUR GUIDE
dialogues.text: Sadly the great dome is closed to visitors today as one of its statues was destroyed in a bizarre accident last night, but if you follow me this way... They see a taped-off crime scene - containing the remnant a SMASHED STATUE - and talk to the SECURITY GUARD on duty (the Sleazy Guard from the Geographers’ Guild in Paddingt

dialogues.speaker: JUDY
dialogues.text: Excuse me? What happened here?

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: A nun went berserk. (off their look) It happens. He nods over to a chapel where A HUNDRED NUNS are being h One very elderly specimen totters away with a walking sti SECURITY GUARD (CONT’D) Hold it there, Sister! You’re not going anywhere ‘til the detective says so. Spin it around. The elderly nun heads back to the group. SECURITY GUARD (CONT’D) The police have rounded them all up but if you ask me, the real culprit’s slipped the net.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: What makes you say that?

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: Because I saw her, that’s what... As the Security Guard tells his story, we see the events the previous evening from his point of view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Security Guard looks down from the top of the dome at nuns parading through the cathedral.  81 82 83 Post Additional Photography Draft 2 - 06.08.17 56.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY GUARD, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I was on patrol in the upper dome watching the nuns parade far below when something caught my eye. Phoenix slips out of the procession.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY GUARD, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: One of them broke free from the herd and made her way to the Whispering Gallery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phoenix races up the staircase. INT. ST. PAUL’S CATHEDRAL / WHISPERING GALLERY - FLASHBAC Phoenix arrives up in the gallery and makes his way round the angel statue indicated in the pop-up book. He pulls himself up onto the base of the statue, inadvertently loosening the rod that secures it to the wa He finds the letter “A” engraved between the angel’s wing

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY GUARD, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Only the Good Lord knows what she was doing up there, but she was never going to get away with it, not while I’m Vice-Deputy Head of Security. The Security Guard appears with a mug of tea.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: or! Phoenix swings down to the gallery flood, putting his who body weight on the rod which secures the statue to the wa It breaks free, and as Phoenix runs off, the statue TOPPL TO THE GROUND where it SMASHES INTO A THOUSAND PIECES. The Security Guard grabs his radio. SECURITY GUARD (CONT’D) Attention all units! INT. ST PAUL’S CATHEDRAL / GEOMETRIC STAIRCASE - FLASHBAC Phoenix runs down the stairs, pulling off his nun’s outfi  Post Additional Photography Draft 2 - 06.08.17 57.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY GUARD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: An unusually attractive nun is causing mayhem in the Cathedral dome. Close in, close in. By the time Phoenix arrives at the bottom of the stairs, has transformed himself into a DECREPIT OLD ARCHBISHOP.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY GUARD, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I set off at lightening speed... The Security Guard ambles off after Phoenix.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phoenix, still dressed as the Archbishop, passes some oth guards without receiving a second glance.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY GUARD, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: But by the time we had locked the place down, she had disappeared into the night.

dialogues.speaker: PHOENIX AS ARCHBISHOP
dialogues.text: Good evening, Gentlemen.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: Good evening, Your Grace. Phoenix disappears into the night. We return to the prese

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Security Guard gazes wistfully into the middle distan

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: Most beautiful woman I’ve seen in a long time. Mary pulls a pencil out of the bun in her hair.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Could you describe her?

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: It would be my pleasure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The prisoners sit in silence, staring at their plates. Everyone has a marmalade sandwich in front of them.  88 Post Additional Photography Draft 2 - 06.08.17 58. Paddington addresses them from behind the counter.

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, for breakfast this morning, Chef McGinty would like to propose an orange marmalade served on a bed of warm crustless bread topped with another piece of warm crustless bread. Bon Appetit. The prisoners all stare at Paddington, not knowing how to respond. But Knuckles appears at the serving hatch.

dialogues.speaker: KNUCKLES
dialogues.text: Two choices: take it or leave it! Knuckles slams the hatch shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paddington enters to find Knuckles tidying up. Paddington see that Knuckles is on edge - and thinks he knows why.

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON
dialogues.text: Are you alright, Knuckles?

dialogues.speaker: KNUCKLES
dialogues.text: (defensive) Yes.

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON
dialogues.text: Why don’t you come and join the others?

dialogues.speaker: KNUCKLES
dialogues.text: Don’t want to.

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON
dialogues.text: Are you scared what they might think?

dialogues.speaker: KNUCKLES
dialogues.text: No! What do they think? Did they like it? Did they say anything? What did they say?

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON
dialogues.text: Well... Knuckles flies into a rage, knocking pans over.

dialogues.speaker: KNUCKLES
dialogues.text: They HATED IT. I knew it! My father always said I'd amount to nothing and he was right!  89 Post Additional Photography Draft 2 - 06.08.17 59.

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON
dialogues.text: Knuckles! Knuckles!

dialogues.speaker: KNUCKLES
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON
dialogues.text: Come and look. Paddington opens the hatch. Knuckles looks through to see

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The prisoners bite into their sandwiches. They make ECSTA NOISES as they eat the best food they’ve tasted in years.

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON
dialogues.text: (to Knuckles) Come on. The pair emerge into the canteen to a round of applause. Knuckles is bursting with amazed pride.

dialogues.speaker: KNUCKLES
dialogues.text: Paddington I’ve got a strange, warm tingle in my tum-tum.

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON
dialogues.text: I think that’s called pride, Knuckles.

dialogues.speaker: KNUCKLES
dialogues.text: Well, I don’t like it. Phibs stands as the applause dies down.

dialogues.speaker: PHIBS
dialogues.text: You got anything else?

dialogues.speaker: KNUCKLES
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: PHIBS
dialogues.text: (now nervous) You know, for pudding?

dialogues.speaker: PHIBS
dialogues.text: (sitting quickly) Fair enough.

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON
dialogues.text: I'm afraid we only know how to make marmalade, so unless you know any recipes...  Post Additional Photography Draft 2 - 06.08.17 60.

dialogues.speaker: KNUCKLES
dialogues.text: This lot? You’re wasting your time with them. They wouldn’t know their pectin from their paprika. Spoon plucks up his courage and stands.

dialogues.speaker: SPOON
dialogues.text: Well, my grandmother used to do a lovely chocolate roulade. I think I can remember the recipe. The Professor stands.

dialogues.speaker: THE PROFESSOR
dialogues.text: Charley Rumble makes a mean apple crumble. Charley, standing, agrees with a low growl. T-Bone stands

dialogues.speaker: T-BONE
dialogues.text: And I can do strawberry panna cotta with a pomegranate glaze.

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON
dialogues.text: Well that sounds wonderful. Doesn’‘t it, Knuckles?

dialogues.speaker: KNUCKLES
dialogues.text: Yeah!

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON
dialogues.text: Come on, then. Let’s get cooking! The CALYPSO BAND play LOVE THY NEIGHBOUR as we see in tim lapse Paddington transforming the prison:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paddington pushes a dessert trolley through the kitchen. he goes, the room transforms from a neglected, dingy spac a sparkling temple of food, thronging with prisoner chefs Spoon hands him a chocolate roulade.

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON
dialogues.text: Thank you, Spoon! Knuckles puts an enormous cake on Paddington’s trolley. PADDINGTON (CONT’D) Woah!

dialogues.speaker: KNUCKLES
dialogues.text: There you go, Paddington.  91 92 93 Post Additional Photography Draft 2 - 06.08.17 61.

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON
dialogues.text: Oh Knuckles!

dialogues.speaker: KNUCKLES
dialogues.text: I need those petit fours now! We follow Paddington as he goes through the swing doors..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And serves prisoners food. The time-lapse continues as th canteen turns into a delightful tearoom around Paddington Red gingham tablecloths appear, along with centre-pieces, cake stands and china tea sets. The prisoners eat and drink politely and daintily. Paddin passes the Professor and puts Knuckles’ cake before him. The Professor immediately takes a piece with his hands.

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON
dialogues.text: Erm, excuse me, Professor, what would Aunt Lucy say?

dialogues.speaker: THE PROFESSOR
dialogues.text: “Always use a cake fork.”

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON
dialogues.text: Well then! The Professor puts a cake fork into the cake and then LEV THE WHOLE PIECE into his mouth. Paddington sets off once more and hands the Warden Spoon’ Chocolate Roulade. PADDINGTON (CONT’D) Care for a taste, Warden?

dialogues.speaker: WARDEN
dialogues.text: Thank you, Paddington! We reach the end of the canteen and Paddington peels off the camera PUSHES THROUGH THE CLOCK MECHANISM...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Past the swinging pendulum as hours whizz by, then out in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera glides down as the whole room is transformed.  94 95 96 Post Additional Photography Draft 2 - 06.08.17 62. Welcome mats appear outside the barred doors, along with hanging baskets, bunting, and fairy lights. Prisoners knit, dance, play chess and raise a giant croch banner which reads “PRISON SWEET PRISON”. INT. WARDEN’S OFFICE - NIGHT The Warden sits in his office at the top of the prison cl tower. By his desk is a MODEL OF THE PRISON. He is reading a BEDTIME STORY into a microphone.

dialogues.speaker: WARDEN
dialogues.text: -..and it turned out the monster wasn’t such a monster after all, and they all lived happily ever after. The end. The prisoners chorus out like children wanting more.

dialogues.speaker: PRISONERS
dialogues.text: Aw!

dialogues.speaker: WARDEN
dialogues.text: Now now. You lot need your sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paddington is lying on his bed. We can hear the Warden’s voice through the tannoy.

dialogues.speaker: WARDEN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: It’s visiting day tomorrow. Paddington stares at a photograph of himself with the Bro on his bedside table.

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON
dialogues.text: Visiting Day. I do hope you have good news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paddington sits in a small PRISON VISITING BOOTH. Henry, Mary, Mrs Bird and the children are on the other s of the glass, their voices coming through a SPEAKER. Judy lays out the latest copy of her newspaper. It shows VARIOUS SKETCHES of Phoenix disguised as the nun, a beefe and Henry V.  Post Additional Photography Draft 2 - 06.08.17

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: In the past month, these three shadowy individuals have all been seen snooping round three London landmarks.

dialogues.speaker: JUDY
dialogues.text: We think the thief you saw is part of a criminal gang...

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Using the pop-up book as a treasure map!

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: (still unconvinced) Well, it’s a theory.

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON
dialogues.text: Do you know who they are?

dialogues.speaker: MRS BIRD
dialogues.text: Not yet, dearie.

dialogues.speaker: KNUCKLES
dialogues.text: Maybe I should take a look. Knuckles has appeared in the window next to Paddington.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Erm, I’m sorry this is a private conversation.

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON
dialogues.text: It’s alright, Mr Brown, this is my friend, Knuckles.

dialogues.speaker: KNUCKLES
dialogues.text: How are you? 63. Other heads start appearing from all angles in the window

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON
dialogues.text: And this is Phibs.

dialogues.speaker: PHIBS
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON
dialogues.text: Spoon.

dialogues.speaker: SPOON
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON
dialogues.text: Jimmy the Snitch.  Post Additional Photography Draft 2 - 06.08.17 64.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY THE SNITCH
dialogues.text: A'right.

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON
dialogues.text: T-bone.

dialogues.speaker: T-BONE
dialogues.text: Wotcha.

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON
dialogues.text: Professor.

dialogues.speaker: THE PROFFESSOR
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON
dialogues.text: Squeaky Pete.

dialogues.speaker: SQUEAKY PETE
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON
dialogues.text: Double bass Bob.

dialogues.speaker: DOUBLE BASS BOB
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON
dialogues.text: Farmer Jack.

dialogues.speaker: OLD TIMER
dialogues.text: How do?

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON
dialogues.text: Mad Dog.

dialogues.speaker: MAD DOG
dialogues.text: Woof!

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON
dialogues.text: Sir Geoffrey Willcot.

dialogues.speaker: SIR GEOFFREY
dialogues.text: I hope I can rely on your vote?

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON
dialogues.text: Johnny Cashpoint.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY CASHPOINT
dialogues.text: Kerching!

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON
dialogues.text: And Charley Rumble. Charley growls. Henry is horrified while Mary, charmed.  Post Additional Photography Draft 2 - 06.08.17 65.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: It’s so lovely to meet you all. I must say it’s a great relief to know Paddington’s already made such sweet friends.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Would you excuse us for a moment? Henry PRESSES A SWITCH and the LIGHT GOES OUT on the Brow side of the booth. He turns to Mary.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Talking to the nice men.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: ‘Nice men’? Mary, we can’t trust these people. I mean look at them! Talk about a rogues’ gallery. Hideous. As for that bearded baboon in the middle, he hasn’t got two brain cells to rub together...

dialogues.speaker: KNUCKLES
dialogues.text: We can still hear you, Mr Brown. Henry freezes. KNUCKLES (CONT’D) That was the light you turned off. Microphone’s on the other side. It has “Microphone” written on it. Judy flicks the light back on. Henry swallows nervously.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Gentlemen. If I have offended you in any way--

dialogues.speaker: KNUCKLES
dialogues.text: Don’t worry about it. We’re fond of the little fella. And let’s face it, if anyone can recognise a criminal gang, it’s us.

dialogues.speaker: JUDY
dialogues.text: We'd be grateful for any help. Judy shows them the pictures.

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON
dialogues.text: Well?  97 Post Additional Photography Draft 2 - 06.08.17 66.

dialogues.speaker: KNUCKLES
dialogues.text: I'm afraid I don’t recognise any of them. Lads? The other prisoners shake their heads and say ‘no’.

dialogues.speaker: SIR GEOFFREY
dialogues.text: I’m afraid I couldn’t possibly comment.

dialogues.speaker: KNUCKLES
dialogues.text: I’m sorry to say it, kid, but your friends are barking up the wrong tree. A nun, a beefeater and a king? Sounds more like a fancy dress party than a criminal gang. Paddington looks around, crestfallen.

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON
dialogues.text: Then what are we going to do now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary leaves the house, the first flakes of snow whirling the air around her. Her head elsewhere, she steps out in front of the cyclist who nearly hits her and responds angrily.

dialogues.speaker: CYCLIST
dialogues.text: Watch where you're going! Mary moves out of the way as the cyclist rides away.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Sorry!

dialogues.speaker: CYCLIST
dialogues.text: Sorry! I get grumpy when I haven’t had breakfast! Mary walks past Dr Jafri who leaves his house and freezes

dialogues.speaker: DR JAFRI
dialogues.text: Keys! Keys, keys... He races back to the door, but without Paddington to remi him, he doesn’t make it in time.

dialogues.speaker: DR JAFRI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Bottoms! Mary passes MR CURRY who is berating the BINMAN, sitting the back of the parked lorry, reading his A-Z Atlas.  Post Additional Photography Draft 2 - 06.08.17 67.

dialogues.speaker: MR CURRY
dialogues.text: You can’t park here!

dialogues.speaker: BINMAN
dialogues.text: I’m not parked, I’m doing the bins.

dialogues.speaker: MR CURRY
dialogues.text: You're not doing the bins, you’re studying - on council time. I’m going to report you. And your hat. Mary arrives at the kiosk. The Colonel is also there.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Morning, Miss Kitts. Colonel.

dialogues.speaker: MISS KITTS
dialogues.text: Morning, Mrs Brown. Mary hands Miss Kitts a bundle of newspapers.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Judy asked me to drop these off.

dialogues.speaker: MR CURRY
dialogues.text: Propaganda!

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL
dialogues.text: Here comes trouble. Mr Curry has spotted them and walks over.

dialogues.speaker: MR CURRY
dialogues.text: You are wasting your time trying to peddle that rubbish. Everyone knows your bear did it. And this street is a far better place without him. Wolfie barks, perhaps protesting Paddington’s innocence. MR CURRY (CONT’D) Oi! It’s that mangy dog! He sets off in pursuit of Wolfie. MR CURRY (CONT’D) You are going to the pound, my son. Barking without a license in a built-up area. I'll ticket you! Miss Kitts takes the papers from Mary.

dialogues.speaker: MISS KITTS
dialogues.text: Give ‘em here, Mary. I have to sell them under the counter for obvious reasons but people are buying them.  Post Additional Photography Draft 2 - 06.08.17 68.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Really? The Colonel pulls a copy from his inside pocket.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL
dialogues.text: It’s a bloomin’ good read. Made a few people round here think twice about your young bear.

dialogues.speaker: MISS KITTS
dialogues.text: You just need to find that thief.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: We're trying. Miss Kitts’ parrot squawks.

dialogues.speaker: MARY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I don’t suppose you know where he is, do you Feathers?

dialogues.speaker: FEATHERS
dialogues.text: He’s behind you!

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: I'm sorry?

dialogues.speaker: PHOENIX, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Mary! Mary turns to see Phoenix has appeared on his balcony beh her. He beckons her into the house.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Oh hello, Phoenix.

dialogues.speaker: PHOENIX
dialogues.text: Come on in. I want you to tell me all about the investigation. 98 INT. PHOENIX’S LIVING ROOM - DAY Mary is sitting in Phoenix’s living room. It is lavishly decorated with throws, rugs and paintings on the walls. Among them is an enormous portrait of Phoenix standing on rock in the Highlands, dressed in a kilt.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Mysterious things have been happening all over town.

dialogues.speaker: PHOENIX
dialogues.text: Oh yes?  Post Additional Photography Draft 2 - 06.08.17 69.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Strange people turning up at every landmark in that book.

dialogues.speaker: PHOENIX
dialogues.text: Have they?

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: I don’t know. Perhaps it’s alla coincidence. Henry says I let my imagination get the better of me.

dialogues.speaker: PHOENIX
dialogues.text: Well you’re an artist Mary, like me. Our imaginations run free, like bison upon the plain. But I do fear on this particular occasion, dear old Henry might be right.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: PHOENIX
dialogues.text: But. I do have some news that might turn your little frown upside down. It looks (fingers, fingers, fingers) as though the funding may be coming through for my one man show.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Oh. Right.

dialogues.speaker: PHOENIX
dialogues.text: An evening of monologue and song featuring some of my better known characters. How about a little preview? Picture the scene. Darkness. Then: Spotlight. Me. Ping! He starts to sing and dance. Mary stares, astonished.

dialogues.speaker: PHOENIX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: “Listen to the rain on the roof go pit pitty pat...” Even Phoenix can’t fail to notice Mary isn’t happy.

dialogues.speaker: PHOENIX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Mary, what’s wrong? Don’t you like musicals?

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: No it’s just... it seems so strange that Paddington’s in prison and yet life just carries on.  Post Additional Photography Draft 2 - 06.08.17 70.

dialogues.speaker: PHOENIX
dialogues.text: Oh I know. It must be hard to accept he won, the man with the dazzling blue eyes. Mary turns to him, stunned.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: What did you say?

dialogues.speaker: PHOENIX
dialogues.text: The man on the poster. Your wonderful drawing!

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: But... how did you know he had blue eyes? It’s a pencil sketch! Phoenix tries to back-pedal.

dialogues.speaker: PHOENIX
dialogues.text: Oh! Well I must have... coloured him in! As Mary stares at Phoenix, her many IDENTIKIT-STYLE DRAWI flicker over his face. And the penny finally drops. INT. BROWNS’ KITCHEN - DAY Mary has just outlined her theory to the family - but Hen is still not convinced.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Phoenix Buchanan?!

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: He’s a master of disguise.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: She’s gone mad.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Think about it Henry. Somewhere out there is the Koslova fortune.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Alleged fortune.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: And Knuckles said we weren't looking for a criminal gang.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Knuckles?

dialogues.speaker: JUDY
dialogues.text: Because there was no gang.  Post Additional Photography Draft 2 - 06.08.17 71.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: It was one man.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: (smiling ruefully) And Feathers knew all along...

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Feathers? Who’s Feathers? Mary realises she might have said too much.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Nobody?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: The parrot at the news stand?!

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Erm...

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Can we return to planet earth for a moment? Phoenix Buchanan is a highly respected, award-winning actor and a member of our Platinum Club. He is not a petty thief. Before Mary can get a word in edgeways, Henry continues.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But let’s just say I’m wrong, shall we? And that the fortune teller, career criminal and parrot are right. May I remind you, you don’t actually have any proof? If anyone wants me, I shall be putting up posters. He leaves, slamming the door behind him.

dialogues.speaker: JUDY
dialogues.text: He’s right.

dialogues.speaker: MRS BIRD
dialogues.text: Well I believe you, Mary. Actors are some of the most evil, devious people on the planet. They lie for a living. If we're going to catch one, we’re going to need a foolproof plan. And once I’ve put this pie in the oven, I’11 tell you one. Mary and the children smile.  100 Post Additional Photography Draft 2 - 06.08.17 72.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paddington is lying in bed when he hears a metallic CLANG followed by a Knuckles’ voice coming along the pipe.

dialogues.speaker: KNUCKLES, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Paddington? Paddington! Paddington climbs up to the horizontal pipes running thro his cell. He opens a vent and can now hear Knuckles clear

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON
dialogues.text: Knuckles? Paddington listens as Knuckles’ voice floats along the pi

dialogues.speaker: KNUCKLES
dialogues.text: Got a proposition for you, kid. Me and the boys have been talking, and it seems to us if you’re going to clear your name, you’re going to need our help.

dialogues.speaker: SPOON
dialogues.text: The Browns may mean well but...

dialogues.speaker: PHIBS
dialogues.text: It takes a thief to catch a thief.

dialogues.speaker: KNUCKLES
dialogues.text: Now if we could somehow get out of here, hit the streets, we’d find him soon enough.

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON
dialogues.text: But that would mean... escape?!

dialogues.speaker: KNUCKLES
dialogues.text: It certainly would. And we've got a plan. But it’s a four man job and we need your help. What do you say? Paddington is sorely tempted - but remembers Aunt Lucy.

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON
dialogues.text: That's very kind, Knuckles, but I don’t think Aunt Lucy would like the idea of me busting out of chokey and going on the lam. The Browns will find the real thief. I just need to be patient. But Knuckles isn’t finished.

dialogues.speaker: KNUCKLES
dialogues.text: You may not want to hear this kid, but sooner or later, the Browns will forget you.  Post Additional Photography Draft 2 - 06.08.17 73. Paddington looks horrified at the suggestion - but despit himself, the words begin to seep into his mind like poiso

dialogues.speaker: PHIBS
dialogues.text: They always do.

dialogues.speaker: SPOON
dialogues.text: They’1l miss one visit. Then two.

dialogues.speaker: KNUCKLES
dialogues.text: And before you know it, you won't have a home to go back to. Paddington shakes his head, refusing to believe.

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON
dialogues.text: You’re wrong, Knuckles. You're all wrong. The Browns aren’t like that. They’11 come tomorrow and they’11l have good news, you'll see. He closes the vent firmly. But Paddington is concerned. 101 EXT. THEATRICAL AGENT’S OFFICE - MORNING Jonathan and Judy walk up to an office building carrying basket of pastries. They ring the buzzer.

dialogues.speaker: JUDY
dialogues.text: It’s Judy Brown from the Portobello Express. They are buzzed in. 102 INT. THEATRICAL AGENT’S OFFICE - MORNING Jonathan and Judy sit in an office, the walls lined with theatrical posters and actors’ photographs. Behind the desk is FLICK FANSHAWE, a glamorous, no-nonsen agent with show-business coursing through her veins. The children are recording the conversation on DICTAPHONES.

dialogues.speaker: FLICK
dialogues.text: So what's this for, darlings? A school newspaper?

dialogues.speaker: JUDY
dialogues.text: Yes, career profiles. We thought the agent of the Phoenix Buchanan would be really interesting.  Post Additional Photography Draft 2 - 06.08.17 74.

dialogues.speaker: FLICK
dialogues.text: And you'd be right, but I’ve got two minutes so we’d better make it snappy. And I’m only giving you that because you brought breakfast. She takes a CHELSEA BUN.

dialogues.speaker: FLICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Nice buns by the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Postman is walking back to his van. Mrs Bird comes ov

dialogues.speaker: MRS BIRD
dialogues.text: Good morning, Marlon.

dialogues.speaker: POSTMAN
dialogues.text: Morning Mrs B. How’s Paddington?

dialogues.speaker: MRS BIRD
dialogues.text: Oh he’s a tough wee bear... As Mrs Bird keeps him talking, Mary sneaks round the othe side of the van, carrying a HUGE BARKRIDGE’S HAMPER. She checks the coast is clear, then climbs into the back the van and GETS INSIDE THE HAMPER.

dialogues.speaker: POSTMAN
dialogues.text: Well, I’d better get on.

dialogues.speaker: MRS BIRD
dialogues.text: Goodbye. The Postman turns back to the van just as MARY CLOSES THE FROM INSIDE. He sees the box and reads the address label.

dialogues.speaker: POSTMAN
dialogues.text: “Mr Buchanan.” 104 INT. AGENT’S OFFICE - DAY

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: So when can we expect to see Mr Buchanan back on stage?

dialogues.speaker: FLICK
dialogues.text: Phoenix?! I wouldn’t hold your breath, darling. Don’t get me wrong, he’s a terrific actor but there’s a teensy little problem: he won’t work with other people. Thinks they dilute his talent.  105 106 107 Post Additional Photography Draft 2 - 06.08.17 75. An assistant knocks at the door.

dialogues.speaker: FLICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ooh. Must scoot. We’re having lunch with a big Broadway producer. She stands to leave.

dialogues.speaker: JUDY
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: FLICK
dialogues.text: Where do all the big meetings happen? The Ritz, darling! She takes another bun from the basket.

dialogues.speaker: FLICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Really nice buns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The POSTMAN staggers up to Phoenix’s front door with MARY HAMPER and rings the bell. From a telephone box across the road, Mrs Bird watches Phoenix open the door and take delivery of the parcel. She picks up the phone and dials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonathan and Judy are in a different telephone box, waiti for a call. Their phone rings and they pick up.

dialogues.speaker: MRS BIRD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: The package has been delivered. They hang up and start to dial. INT. PHOENIX’S HALLWAY - MORNING Phoenix opens the hamper. It seems to be full of straw. He is about to delve into it - when his PHONE RINGS. He answers and hears his AGENT’S VOICE.

dialogues.speaker: FLICK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Phoenix!

dialogues.speaker: PHOENIX
dialogues.text: Felicity! What a pleasant surprise. I was beginning to think you’d lost my number.  Post Additional Photography Draft 2 - 06.08.17 76.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judy and Jonathan are PLAYING EXTRACTS FROM THE INTERVIEW their DICTAPHONES. Judy presses play.

dialogues.speaker: FLICK
dialogues.text: “I've got two minutes so we’d better make it snappy.”

dialogues.speaker: PHOENIX, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Ok... Jonathan presses play on the other dictaphone.

dialogues.speaker: FLICK
dialogues.text: “We're having lunch with a big Broadway producer.” 109 INT. PHOENIX’S LIVING ROOM - MORNING PHOENIX still believes he’s in a real conversation.

dialogues.speaker: PHOENIX
dialogues.text: Well that’s wonderful. Where should I go?

dialogues.speaker: FLICK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: “Where do all the big meetings happen? The Ritz, darling!”

dialogues.speaker: PHOENIX
dialogues.text: I’m on my way.

dialogues.speaker: FLICK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: “Nice buns by the way.”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judy has left a tape recorder going by mistake - and it h played the wrong line. Judy stops it but they’re panicking. Have they been rumbl 111 INT. PHOENIX’S LIVING ROOM - MORNING

dialogues.speaker: PHOENIX
dialogues.text: I beg your pardon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonathan has an idea - and presses a button.

dialogues.speaker: FLICK
dialogues.text: “Really nice buns!”  113 114 115 Post Additional Photography Draft 2 - 06.08.17 77. INT. PHOENIX’S LIVING ROOM - MORNING PHOENIX looks bemused, but somewhat pleased with himself.

dialogues.speaker: PHOENIX
dialogues.text: Well, thank you very much. I’ve never had any complaints about Mr and Mrs Botty-cheek. He hangs up, grabs his coat and leaves. As the door shuts behind him, something shifts in the ham Mary EMERGES FROM THE STRAW. INT. HENRY AND MARY’S BATHROOM - MORNING Henry, still in his pyjamas, is brushing his teeth - when GLANCES OUT THE WINDOW - which looks out along the garden behind the houses. He sees Mary in PHOENIX’S LIVING ROOM.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Mary?! INT. PHOENIX’S LIVING ROOM - MORNING Mary is rifling through Phoenix’s paperwork, not sure wha she’s looking for, when she spots a blank, used notepad. Using the side of a pencil, she uncovers the indentations left from the previous note. Saturday 06:35 Where All Your Dreams Come True BANG BANG BANG! There is a SHARP KNOCK at the window. MARY JUMPS OUT OF HER SKIN - but it’s just HENRY. Mary goes and opens the window.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Have you gone insane?

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: I know it's Phoenix and I'm going to prove it. Henry climbs through the window.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: This is breaking and entering!

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: We haven't broken anything.  Post Additional Photography Draft 2 - 06.08.17 78. Henry knocks over a vase. It smashes on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Why would Phoenix steal a pop-up book? He’s a millionaire!

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Well that’s where you’re wrong. He owes money all over town. She thrusts some paperwork into Henry’s hands.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: So he’s got a few bills, I mean everyone-- good grief the man spends a lot on face cream.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: He hasn’t got a penny to his name. Now come on. Let’s find that book and get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phoenix is walking down the street. He realises he has forgotten his cravat and turns back the way he’s come. 117 INT. PHOENIX’S LANDING - DAY Henry and Mary stand at the top of the landing. They’ve searched the whole house with no luck. Mary sighs.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: We must be missing something.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Unless there’s nothing to find. Can we please go? They head downstairs. But suddenly, something catches Mar eye. In the landing carpet, there are TWO INDENTATIONS.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Look, Henry, the carpet!

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: It’s lovely I’1ll order a swatch. She looks up at the PANELLED CEILING above her.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Give me a leg-up. Henry reluctantly does so, creaking as he bends over.  Post Additional Photography Draft 2 - 06.08.17 79.

dialogues.speaker: MARY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What’s that noise?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: It’s me.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Gosh you really do creak.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Can we just get on with it? He hoists her up to the ceiling where she presses a ceili panel - and it SWINGS OPEN. A STEP LADDER UNFOLDS, its feet landing in the two divots

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: A secret room!

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: It’s an attic.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: A secret attic.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: It’s an ordinary attic. Mary heads up, followed by Henry.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Every house on the street has one. See? Just a perfectly normal...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry sees Phoenix's mannequins.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Oh my god, he’s a weirdo.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Look, Henry! The nun! The thief! The King!

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: We were right!

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: We?!

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Well, I never said... Suddenly, they hear the noise of the front door opening.  Post Additional Photography Draft 2 - 06.08.17 80. 119 INT. PHOENIX’S HALLWAY - DAY Phoenix comes through the front door. 120 INT. PHOENIX’S ATTIC ROOM - DAY Henry and Mary creep down the ladder and close the hatch behind them. They peer over the banisters and see Phoenix going into t bathroom at the back of the hall. 121 INT. PHOENIX’S HALLWAY - DAY They get to the bottom of the stairs and run to the front door but Phoenix turns back to the hall - so they have to BOLT INTO THE LIVING ROOM to hide. Phoenix walks through the hall and hears footsteps. He grabs a WALKING STICK SWORD from the umbrella stand in hall and goes into the living room.

dialogues.speaker: PHOENIX
dialogues.text: Hello? Who goes there? Show yourself! I am armed and schooled. Everything seems normal - apart from one thing: HENRY'S L disappearing behind the sofa.

dialogues.speaker: PHOENIX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Henry? Henry sheepishly gets to his feet. He can’t help noticing Phoenix is brandishing a sword.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Hello Phoenix.

dialogues.speaker: PHOENIX
dialogues.text: What on earth are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: I might ask you the same thing.

dialogues.speaker: PHOENIX
dialogues.text: I live here! It’s my house.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: And I... insure it. And for our Platinum Club members, we perform an annual full home inspection to verify your security arrangements.

dialogues.speaker: PHOENIX
dialogues.text: In your pyjamas?  122 Post Additional Photography Draft 2 - 06.08.17 81.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Mm-hm.

dialogues.speaker: PHOENIX
dialogues.text: With your wife? Phoenix pulls back a curtain to reveal Mary, who taps the window, pretending she was inspecting it.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: ...seems pretty secure. Oh, hello Phoenix! Didn’t hear you come in.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: She helps out when we're busy.

dialogues.speaker: PHOENIX
dialogues.text: Well I must say that sounds... plausible.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Does it? Great. Well I’m delighted to say everything seems tickety- boo...

dialogues.speaker: PHOENIX
dialogues.text: Wonderful.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: So we'd better get cracking. Phoenix ushers them towards the door.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'll get the boys in the office to type this up asap and hope to see you soon.

dialogues.speaker: PHOENIX
dialogues.text: Absolutely. Though next time, perhaps not in your pyjamas, eh? They all laugh far too much. Phoenix shuts the door and h smile drops as he darts upstairs. INT. PHOENIX’S ATTIC ROOM - CONTINUOUS Phoenix bursts in. The POP-UP book is still there, locked his make-up table. He breaths a huge sigh of relief.

dialogues.speaker: PHOENIX
dialogues.text: Oh thank Larry it’s there. Thank Larry, Johnny and all the ghosts of the avenue.

dialogues.speaker: PHOENIX AS MAGWICH
dialogues.text: That was close.  Post Additional Photography Draft 2 - 06.08.17 82.

dialogues.speaker: PHOENIX AS MACBETH
dialogues.text: Aye. Too close if you ask me. Phoenix opens the book.

dialogues.speaker: PHOENIX
dialogues.text: Hold your nerve, MacBeth. Screw your courage to the sticking post. We are so nearly there. I have followed this little lady all the way across London and found every one of her clever little clues.

dialogues.speaker: PHOENIX AS MACBETH
dialogues.text: Aye. But what do they mean?

dialogues.speaker: PHOENIX AS MAGWICH
dialogues.text: It’s just a jumble of letters.

dialogues.speaker: PHOENIX AS POIROT
dialogues.text: Au contraire, mon ami. They are not letters at all. They are musical notes.

dialogues.speaker: PHOENIX
dialogues.text: Indeed, Poirot. And I believe I know just where to play them. He looks at the back cover of the book, which features a picture of the FAIRGROUND ORGAN and the words ‘WHERE ALL DREAMS COME TRUE.’

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From outside, we can hear the Browns all talking at once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Browns and Mrs Bird are lined up at the counter, maki their case to the Policewoman who arrested Paddington.

dialogues.speaker: POLICEWOMAN
dialogues.text: Hold it, hold it! That is an amazing story, but all you've proved is that Phoenix Buchanan keeps his old costumes. Bring me some hard evidence, bring me the book with his finger prints on it, and you've got a case. But until then, there’s nothing I can do. I’m sorry. She walks away. The Browns are distraught.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: What are we going to do now?  125 126 Post Additional Photography Draft 2 - 06.08.17 83.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: MRS BIRD
dialogues.text: At least we can tell Paddington we know who did it. But just then, a CLOCK starts to strike. They look up.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Oh no!

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: JUDY
dialogues.text: We've missed visiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paddington sits in the visiting booth, holding his paws. anxiously cranes his neck to look for the Browns. But a klaxon sounds, marking the end of visiting. And nob has come for him. All the lights go out. Paddington is left in the dark. INT. PADDINGTON’S CELL - NIGHT Paddington lies on his bed gazing at the photograph of hi with the Browns. As he does so, his face disappears from the picture. Now just the Browns, smiling out at him without their bear. A SINGLE TEAR rolls down his nose and SPLASHES ON THE FLO But then, where the tear has fallen between two stone sla a TINY GREEN SHOOT APPEARS and a leaf unfurls. As Paddington watches, MORE AND MORE SHOOTS APPEAR, growi upwards through the cracks in the floor. CREEPERS WRAP THEMSELVES AROUND the iron bars of the CELL DOOR which thicken and BECOME TREES. Paddington stands up. And around him, instead of the cell the majesty of the PERUVIAN RAINFOREST. He hears a familiar sound.

dialogues.speaker: AUNT LUCY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Paddington!  127 Post Additional Photography Draft 2 - 06.08.17 84. He looks up and suddenly Aunt Lucy is there before him.

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON
dialogues.text: Aunt Lucy! He races through the jungle and flies into her arms.

dialogues.speaker: AUNT LUCY
dialogues.text: What are you doing here? I thought you'd be at home.

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON
dialogues.text: I'm afraid I haven’t got one any more. You see, I’m in prison. And even the Browns have forgotten me. The jungle behind him disappears and he is back in prison And he hears a now familiar knock at the pipes.

dialogues.speaker: KNUCKLES, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Paddington! Paddington goes and opens the vent on the pipe.

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON
dialogues.text: Knuckles?

dialogues.speaker: KNUCKLES
dialogues.text: Tonight’s the night, kid. We leave at midnight. You want to clear your name, it’s now or never. You in? Paddington swallows, and then replies, reluctantly.

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON
dialogues.text: I’m in. INT. WARDEN’S OFFICE - NIGHT The clock strikes twelve. The WARDEN stands up to leave.

dialogues.speaker: WARDEN
dialogues.text: (to himself) Right. Time to call it a night. Nothing much going on round here, anyway. They’ve been as good as gold recently. He switches out the light in the room. But the camera pushes into the Warden’s MODEL OF THE MAIN PRISON BUILDING and the FRONT SWINGS OPEN LIKE A DOLLS HO showing a CROSS-SECTION OF THE PRISON. The PRISONERS are all in their cells while GUARDS patrol staircases and corridors.  128 129 130 131 132 133 134 Post Additional Photography Draft 2 - 06.08.17 85. A SEARCHLIGHT sweeps across the entire prison complex fro the WATCH TOWER above a clock on top of the CENTRAL HALL. In FOUR CELLS on the top floor, KNUCKLES, PHIBS, SPOON an PADDINGTON get out of bed, and DROP THROUGH THE FLOORBOAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera drops down through the floor with them and tra along the prisoners as they crawl to the end of the build Knuckles unscrews a panel, and drops down the LAUNDRY CHU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The prisoners drop one by one onto a PILE OF LAUNDRY and out through a door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The prisoners run into a long room supported by pillars. Running the entire length of one wall are PIGEON HOLES containing parcels of the prisoners’ clothes. They each grabs a parcel of clothes, then Paddington is l by Knuckles to a hatch which leads into the CLOCK MECHANI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paddington shimmies up the pendulum and at the top squeez into the clockwork mechanism. Like Charlie Chaplin in MODERN TIMES he rides the cogs up until he is deposited on the floor of the Warden's office

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paddington grabs a key and heads out of the office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Prisoners use the key Paddington took to let themselv into the canteen. They run through grabbing a PILE OF TABLECLOTHS on the wa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They shimmy up to the skylight above the kitchen, carryin the tablecloths, laundry basket and now a PROPANE TANK.  Post Additional Photography Draft 2 - 06.08.17 86.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The prisoners wait for the searchlight to sweep past the kitchen, then climb out of the skylight and run along the roof to the shadows at the base of the watch tower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The light sweeps over them once more and the prisoners cl to the roof above the watch tower guard. They open the basket and pull out an ENORMOUS SHEET OF TA CLOTHS that have been STITCHED TOGETHER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phibs opens the valve of the propane tank. Spoon ignites the flame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T-BONE looks out the window and double-takes. Rising from the roof of the watch tower is a HOT AIR BALL The CANOPY is made of TABLECLOTHS, the BASKET is the laun basket, and it's fuelled by PROPANE. And riding in it are Knuckles, Phibs, Spoon and Paddingto

dialogues.speaker: T-BONE
dialogues.text: Good luck, little bear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BALLOON floats OVER THE PRISON WALL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three prisoners hurl their prison hats and jackets into t sky, whooping with delight at their escape. But Paddington looks out at the city he loves, worried ab the choice he has made, scared of being a fugitive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Knuckles and the others are wearing the civilian clothes took with them. Paddington is back in his hat and coat.  Post Additional Photography Draft 2 - 06.08.17 87.

dialogues.speaker: KNUCKLES
dialogues.text: Bring her down, Spoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The balloon comes to earth by a derelict factory on the r in the east end of London. The prisoners tumble out of the basket and run through th factory to the wharf as the balloon deflates behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The prisoners run up to the wharf where a SEAPLANE waits.

dialogues.speaker: KNUCKLES
dialogues.text: There she is, boys. Our ticket out of here. Paddington is startled by this statement.

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON
dialogues.text: What do you mean? Where are you going? The prisoners look guiltily to one another.

dialogues.speaker: SPOON
dialogues.text: May as well tell him, Knuckles.

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON
dialogues.text: Tell me what? Aren’t we going to clear my name?

dialogues.speaker: KNUCKLES
dialogues.text: (sheepishly) Sorry, kid, er... Change of plan. Paddington can scarcely believe what he’s hearing.

dialogues.speaker: PHIBS
dialogues.text: We're leaving the country!

dialogues.speaker: SPOON
dialogues.text: And you're coming with us!

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON
dialogues.text: But you said... You lied to me! Knuckles feels ashamed of the deception but genuinely believes he’s done the right thing.

dialogues.speaker: KNUCKLES
dialogues.text: Hey now, it’s not like that. We were doing you a favour. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 144 Post Additional Photography Draft 2 - 06.08.17 88.

dialogues.speaker: KNUCKLES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If we’d told you the truth you’d never have come along - and it’s better this way. We’1l make marmalade together!

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON
dialogues.text: But I don’t want to, Knuckles. I want to go clear my name and go home. And you said you'd help! You promised!

dialogues.speaker: KNUCKLES
dialogues.text: (hardening his heart) Sorry, kid. No can do. Hearing this, Paddington just turns and runs.

dialogues.speaker: SPOON
dialogues.text: Paddington!

dialogues.speaker: KNUCKLES
dialogues.text: Let him go. If he wants to get himself arrested, it’s his choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paddington walks down a main road, all alone in the world Behind him, a POLICE CAR turns on its siren and drives towards him. Paddington ducks into an alley, screwing his eyes shut and waiting for the inevitable. But the Police Car passes by. Paddington heaves a sigh of relief - and looks up to see a TELEPHONE BOX in the alley An idea occurs to him. He finds a single coin in his pock the one Mrs Bird found in his ear at breakfast. He goes in to the phone box, picks up the receiver and di

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hello! Paddington is delighted to hear his friend’s voice.

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON
dialogues.text: Hello, Jonathan! It’s Pad-

dialogues.speaker: JUDY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You’ve reached the Brown residence! Paddington’s heart sinks as he realises he’s not got thro to the Browns, merely their answer-phone.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: We're not in but leave a message!  Post Additional Photography Draft 2 - 06.08.17 89. The answer-phone beeps.

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON
dialogues.text: Hello, it’s me, Paddington. 145 INT. BROWNS’ HALLWAY - NIGHT Paddington’s voice echoes in the empty hallway.

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I hope you don’t mind my calling. I just wanted to let you know I've broken out of prison and, well, I suppose I’m on the run. I didn’t really mean to but Knuckles said if we broke out, he’d help clear my name, and then I could come home.

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON
dialogues.text: But he’s gone now and I’m on my own. The pips go. PADDINGTON (CONT’D) I don’t really know why I’m calling. I suppose I just wanted to say... The line goes dead. PADDINGTON (CONT’D) ...goodbye. He hangs up, his heart ready to burst. He picks up his case and walks away from the phone box. But then, behind him, the TELEPHONE RINGS. Scarcely daring to believe, he turns and races to the pho PADDINGTON (CONT’D) Hello?

dialogues.speaker: MARY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Paddington? Relief floods through Paddington.

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON
dialogues.text: Yes! Yes, it’s Paddington!  Post Additional Photography Draft 2 - 06.08.17 90. 147 INT. BROWNS’ HOUSE / PHONE BOX - NIGHT Mary beckons Henry - who is just coming in from postering to join her and the rest of the family at the phone.

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON
dialogues.text: I’m so sorry I escaped, Mrs Brown but I thought you’d forgotten me.

dialogues.speaker: MRS BIRD
dialogues.text: We'd never forget you, Paddington!

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Paddington?!

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: You're family!

dialogues.speaker: JUDY
dialogues.text: And we know who the thief was!

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Phoenix Buchanan!

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON
dialogues.text: Mr Buchanan?!

dialogues.speaker: MRS BIRD
dialogues.text: But he’s disappeared into thin air. Mary looks at the piece of paper she took from his house.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: We've been looking for him at every landmark in that book, every last page.

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON
dialogues.text: ‘Where all your dreams come true’.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Why do you say that?

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON
dialogues.text: It was written on the last page of the pop-up book. Always made me think of Aunt Lucy.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: That’s funny. I found the exact same phrase on a piece of paper at Phoenix’s house.

dialogues.speaker: JUDY
dialogues.text: I’m sure I’ve seen that before. Judy looks at the cover of an old copy of her newspaper. has the picture of Phoenix and Paddington opening the fai  Post Additional Photography Draft 2 - 06.08.17 91. On the organ behind them is the FAIRGROUND ORGAN, and on that, the words ‘Where All Your Dreams Come True!’

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: The Organ!

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: That must be where Madame Kozlova hid her fortune.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Then let’s get to the fair!

dialogues.speaker: JUDY
dialogues.text: Too late. They’re leaving today.

dialogues.speaker: JUDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: From Paddington Station.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: (looking at her paper) At 6.35.

dialogues.speaker: MRS BIRD
dialogues.text: There’s still time.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Paddington, get to the station. If we can find Phoenix and get hold of that book, his fingerprints will prove everything.

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON
dialogues.text: But that’s miles away, Mr Brown, I’ll never... Paddington hears the DISTINCTIVE HORN OF THE BIN LORRY an looks down the alley to see MR BARNES, the BINMAN. PADDINGTON (CONT’D) I’ll see you there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paddington rides the dustbin lorry as it drives through t Cars screech to a halt around them.

dialogues.speaker: MR BARNES
dialogues.text: Clear the road! This is a refuse emergency!  Post Additional Photography Draft 2 - 06.08.17 92.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr Curry is standing by the newspaper kiosk his dressing with a loud hailer. A homemade neighborhood ‘Panic board’ sits in the road next to him.

dialogues.speaker: MR CURRY
dialogues.text: Fellow citizens. This is your Community Defence Force Commander. The neighbours come to their windows, woken by the sound. MR CURRY (CONT’D) I have just received intelligence the bear has escaped from prison and may be heading this way. I am raising the neighborhood panic level to “Wild Hysteria”. He shifts the arrow on his board from “Extremely Jittery” “Wild Hysteria”. The Browns run out of their house towards their car.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Get out of the way, Mr Curry.

dialogues.speaker: JUDY
dialogues.text: Paddington’s not heading this way.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: He’s going to clear his name.

dialogues.speaker: MRS BIRD
dialogues.text: And we're going to bring him home!

dialogues.speaker: MR CURRY
dialogues.text: We don’t want him here! Henry stops and approaches him. And as he speaks, the neighbours begin to understand the truth of his words.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Of course you don’t! You never have. You took one look at that bear and you made up your mind. Well Paddington’s not like that. He looks for the good in all of us and somehow, he finds it. He wouldn’t hesitate if any of us needed help. So stand aside, Mr Curry, because we're coming through! Henry tries to start the car. But it stalls.

dialogues.speaker: MR CURRY
dialogues.text: Oh very good! Your plan seems to have stalled. Like your vehicle.  Post Additional Photography Draft 2 - 06.08.17 93. But suddenly the car begins to move. Henry looks around, amazed, to see the neighbours have gathered around their and are pushing it.

dialogues.speaker: DR JAFRI
dialogues.text: Second gear, clutch down, Mr Brown.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL
dialogues.text: After three? Three!

dialogues.speaker: MR CURRY
dialogues.text: What’s going on? What are you doing? Do not push that vehicle!

dialogues.speaker: DR JAFRI
dialogues.text: Bring Paddington home. The car roars into life and heads toward the newspaper ki Mr Curry jumps out of the way as the car runs over the Pa Board. The neighbours all cheer in relief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dustbin lorry pulls up at the station. The Bin Man jumps down, takes the PLASTIC SLEEVE off a LI BIN by the entrance, and puts it over Paddington.

dialogues.speaker: MR BARNES
dialogues.text: Now Paddington, keep your head down and remember, you’re a bin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bin walks across the concourse, muttering to itself.

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You're a bin, you’re a bin, just an ordinary bin, going for a walk. He suddenly freezes as he sees a DOZY POLICEMAN approach, eating a doughnut. He ducks as the Policeman puts half a doughnut in the bin

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Thank you! The Policeman freezes. That was weird.

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Nothing to see here, Officer, just a bin.  Post Additional Photography Draft 2 - 06.08.17 94. The Policeman shrugs and goes on his way. Paddington pops eating the doughnut.

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: It’s quite good being a bin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Browns’ car races over a bridge near Paddington. Beyo the station are the first gleams of the winter dawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paddington waits in the bin by the Fair Train, watching a TRAIN PORTER APPROACH. It’s PHOENIX IN DISGUISE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Browns pull up at the station and leap out of the car

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A whistle is blown and the train starts to move. Phoenix onto the platform at the back of the FAIRGROUND ORGAN TRU in the MIDDLE OF THE TRAIN. Paddington casts off the bin, and leaps onto the platform the front of the REAR TRUCK as the train picks up speed. The Browns run onto the platform as the train pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Paddington! They run faster, drawing near the moving train. Paddingto out from the rear truck and calls to them.

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON
dialogues.text: Mr Brown! Quickly! He’s on board! Henry reaches out, almost touching the last truck. But the train pulls away from them - and it’s gone. PADDINGTON (CONT’D) Don’t worry, I’1l handle it myself. The Browns stand at the end of the platform, bereft.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: We've got to catch up with that train.  Post Additional Photography Draft 2 - 06.08.17 95.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: But how? On the platform behind them, ANOTHER STEAM TRAIN whistles Jonathan turns to see THE BELMOND BRITISH PULLMAN idling the next platform.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: I’ve got an idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The JUDGE and his WIFE are sitting in a smart carriage. A STEWARD comes and offers them champagne.

dialogues.speaker: STEWARD
dialogues.text: Good morning Madam, Sir. May I offer you a glass of champagne?

dialogues.speaker: WIFE
dialogues.text: Oh how lovely! Thank you very much.

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE
dialogues.text: Very civilised. Nice to have a break after all I’ve been through with that beastly bear.

dialogues.speaker: WIFE
dialogues.text: Don’t you think you were a little harsh on him, darling?

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE
dialogues.text: Harsh, Gertrude? Nonsense. In life, people get what they deserve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonathan is starting the train. the rest of the family lo on, amazed by his expertise.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Boiler pressure, 225. Water, half a glass. Air brake, off.

dialogues.speaker: JUDY
dialogues.text: Nice work, J-Dog!

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: My name’s not J-Dog. It’s Jonathan Brown. And I like steam trains. He pulls a lever and the train lurches forward.  159 160 Post Additional Photography Draft 2 - 06.08.17 96.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sudden lurch makes the Steward slosh champagne all ov the Judge, who is immediately irate.

dialogues.speaker: STEWARD
dialogues.text: I’m so sorry, sir.

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE
dialogues.text: Get off me! Get off! The Judge's Wife starts shushing him.

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don’t shush me, Gertrude. I have just been spilled upon by chilled liquid!

dialogues.speaker: WIFE
dialogues.text: Gerald? I want you to shush. The Judge is silenced.

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE
dialogues.text: Yes Gertrude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spoon pilots the plane high over the English countryside while Knuckles tunes a portable radio.

dialogues.speaker: RADIO
dialogues.text: Four convicts made a daring escape from Portobello Prison last night. The prisoners all appear to have vanished without a trace... The three prisoners are delighted: they’ve got clean away

dialogues.speaker: RADIO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ...except Paddington Brown, who was seen boarding a train bound for Bristol. Police are closing in and expect to make an arrest soon. The prisoners are visibly deflated by the news. Phibs loo out of the window at the railway line far below.

dialogues.speaker: PHIBS
dialogues.text: Poor little guy. He must be somewhere down there right now. Probably scared half to death.

dialogues.speaker: SPOON
dialogues.text: Shouldn't we help him, Knuckles?  161 162 Post Additional Photography Draft 2 - 06.08.17 97.

dialogues.speaker: KNUCKLES
dialogues.text: If we go down there now, they won’t just lock us up, they’1ll throw away the key.

dialogues.speaker: SPOON
dialogues.text: I know but... he’s our friend.

dialogues.speaker: KNUCKLES
dialogues.text: We stick to the plan. I don’t do nuthin for no-one for nuthin. But as he looks out of the window, his eyes fill with tea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Fair Train races away from London and into rural Engl The camera pushes in towards the front truck which contai the Fairground Organ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phoenix walks into the ORGAN TRUCK, taking off the wig he wore to disguise himself as the Porter. He pulls a TARPAULIN off the FAIRGROUND ORGAN. He looks a one of the mannequin figures on the organ: the magician.

dialogues.speaker: PHOENIX
dialogues.text: Well, Grandfather, the moment of truth. He takes the pop-up book from his bag and turns to the fi page, Tower Bridge.

dialogues.speaker: PHOENIX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ape He presses the corresponding note on the ORGAN KEYBOARD. light appears.

dialogues.speaker: PHOENIX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s working. He starts putting in the other notes, but at the far end the carriage, Paddington is watching through the window. He spots the book, a HATCH in the roof above it, and remembers Henry’s words.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: If we can find that book, his fingerprints will prove everything. Paddington looks around and spots a BARREL OF TOFFEE APPL A plan begins to formulate in his mind.  Post Additional Photography Draft 2 - 06.08.17
Judy is leaning out of the cab. Looking through her camer telephoto lens she can see Paddington climbing towards th roof with a couple of toffee apples.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: What’s he doing?

dialogues.speaker: JUDY
dialogues.text: I don’t know!

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Paddington!

dialogues.speaker: JUDY
dialogues.text: He can’t hear us! Henry swings inside.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Can this thing go any faster?

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: I can try but we need more coal!

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: I’m on it.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Try to pull alongside. I’m going across.

dialogues.speaker: JUDY
dialogues.text: I‘1l come with you.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Judy...

dialogues.speaker: MRS BIRD
dialogues.text: Just you try and stop us.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Come on then. He swings out of the cab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paddington climbs up onto the roof. Using the toffee apples like SUCKERS, he makes the windy roof to the SKYLIGHT above Phoenix's his way along head. Suddenly, he spots a tunnel approaching and has to LIMBO BACKWARDS to avoid being squashed.  165 166 Post Additional Photography Draft 2 - 06.08.17 99. He emerges from the tunnel, COVERED IN SOOT, and continue towards Phoenix.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry, Judy and Mrs Bird climb out onto the FRONT OF THE ENGINE. Henry helps Mrs Bird and Judy onto the FAIR TRAIN Lastly, he reaches out with one leg and gets ONE FOOT on PLATFORM at the back of the FAIR TRAIN. But suddenly the TRACKS PART and Henry finds his LEGS BEI PULLED WIDE APART between the two trains.

dialogues.speaker: CHAKRABATICS INSTRUCTOR, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Open your mind and your legs will follow. Henry goes into a zen state and manages to do the splits. But then, suddenly, he spots a telegraph pole rushing tow him and screams for help. Luckily, Mrs Bird hears him, runs back to the platform an pulls him to safety.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Thank heavens for Chakrabatics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PHOENIX is putting in the last of the code. Above him, Paddington opens the HATCH and looks down.

dialogues.speaker: PHOENIX
dialogues.text: “E". And "E." Suddenly the WHOLE FAIRGROUND ORGAN LIGHTS UP. Phoenix st forward, hypnotised by the splendour of what he’s seeing. Behind him, Paddington SWINGS THROUGH THE SKYLIGHT, using toffee apples like suckers to HANG FROM THE ROOF. With a whirring of cogs, the ORGAN BEGINS TO OPEN. The pi sink down, and the mannequin of Madame Koslova rises into body of the machine, exposing a complex CLOCKWORK MECHANI Behind Phoenix, Paddington creeps along towards the book, sound of the toffee apples masked by the sound of the org Meanwhile, a TREASURE BOX rises out of the organ mechanis Phoenix stares, entranced, as the box opens, revealing it treasure: piles of gold jewellery, trinkets and diamonds.

dialogues.speaker: PHOENIX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hello!  167 168 Post Additional Photography Draft 2 - 06.08.17 100. Behind him, Paddington manages to grab the book - and sta inching his way back towards the skylight.

dialogues.speaker: PHOENIX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Aren’t you pretty! West End, here I come! Suddenly the organ stops playing and now Phoenix can hear sound of the toffee apples on the roof behind him. He turns round to see Paddington, upside down, nose to no with him.

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON
dialogues.text: Morning, Mr Buchanan. Phoenix steps back, astounded and accidentally KICKS THE ORGAN KEYBOARD. The TREASURE BOX slams shut and the pipes descend, hiding treasure.

dialogues.speaker: PHOENIX
dialogues.text: Nott!!! Phoenix tries to put the code back in as Paddington scram out onto the roof with the book.

dialogues.speaker: D...G...
dialogues.text: (no luck) D...E... Finding he can’t remember the code, he runs after Padding

dialogues.speaker: PHOENIX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come back with that book!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry, Mrs Bird and Judy runs through the Chair-o-Planes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phoenix climbs onto the roof and chases the bear.

dialogues.speaker: PHOENIX
dialogues.text: Where do you think you’re going, bear? It’s a train! It comes to an end, like all of us alas. Paddington looks round to see that he has, indeed, reache the back of the train. He skids to a halt, only just avoiding falling off the tr  Post Additional Photography Draft 2 - 06.08.17 101.

dialogues.speaker: PHOENIX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Whoops! Paddington turns to see Phoenix striding towards him.

dialogues.speaker: PHOENIX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Exit bear, pursued by an actor. But suddenly he FALLS THROUGH A SKYLIGHT into a truck bel

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phoenix sits up to see Henry, Judy and Mrs Bird.

dialogues.speaker: MRS BIRD
dialogues.text: Phoenix Buchanan.

dialogues.speaker: PHOENIX
dialogues.text: Mrs Bird?!

dialogues.speaker: MRS BIRD
dialogues.text: So now you remember!

dialogues.speaker: PHOENIX
dialogues.text: And she’s brought the cavalry! A little girl and an insurance man. (mock fear) What am I going to do?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: (raising his fists) I'll tell you exactly what I'm going to do. I’m going to bloomin’ well biff you on the nose. Phoenix grabs a SWORD-SWALLOWER’S SWORD from the wall and brandishes it professionally.

dialogues.speaker: PHOENIX
dialogues.text: Not a very good idea. Stage combat level four. Mrs Bird grabs a gun from a rack at his end of the carria

dialogues.speaker: MRS BIRD
dialogues.text: Well where I come from, laddie, they teach you never to bring a knife to a gunfight.

dialogues.speaker: PHOENIX
dialogues.text: I think you’ll find that fires plastic darts. Mrs Bird fires a gun - and the dart sticks onto Phoenix’s forehead. He pulls it off with a pop.  Post Additional Photography Draft 2 - 06.08.17 102.

dialogues.speaker: MRS BIRD
dialogues.text: So it does.

dialogues.speaker: PHOENIX
dialogues.text: Whereas this sword is razor sharp. He slices his sword through some stuffed animals. The Bro jump, terrified. He starts walking them back into the nex carriage, grabbing some handcuffs on his way.

dialogues.speaker: PHOENIX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Back you go.

dialogues.speaker: ENT. FAIR TRAIN / REAR TRUCK
dialogues.text: The two train lines are coming together again. Paddington climbs down from the roof to the PLATFORM at the back of rear truck where he first climbed on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Steward is serving the Judge an enormous pudding.

dialogues.speaker: STEWARD
dialogues.text: And for you, sir, the jumbo pavlova. At that moment, he looks out to see Paddington on the tra waving towards him.

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON
dialogues.text: Afternoon, Your Honour. The hair’s looking lovely. It’s all too much for the Judge, who passes out into his pudding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paddington is suddenly amazed to spot MRS BROWN in the driver’s cab at the other end of the train.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Paddington! Slow down, Jonathan. Jonathan puts on the brakes, bringing the Pullman cab int line with Paddington. But the trains are still a good thi feet apart - with no obvious way of getting across. Paddington sees his suitcase and has an idea.  173 174 175 176 Post Additional Photography Draft 2 - 06.08.17 103.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry, Mary and Mrs Bird have been handcuffed to some pol Phoenix checks they’re securely fastened.

dialogues.speaker: PHOENIX
dialogues.text: Good, good, excellent. Now for your furry friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paddington opens his suitcase and pulls out his TELESCOPI LADDER. He wedges the top end of the ladder into a gap in the floorboards of the platform at the back of the train. Paddington climbs onto the bottom end of the ladder and starts WINDING IT OUT towards the PULLMAN, hoping to crea bridge between the two trains. Suddenly, Phoenix appears at the door and spots Paddingto

dialogues.speaker: PHOENIX
dialogues.text: Coo-ee! He tries to go through the door - but it’s locked. He thr a shoulder against it.

dialogues.speaker: JUDY
dialogues.text: What are we going to do? Mrs Bird pulls a pin out of her hair.

dialogues.speaker: MRS BIRD
dialogues.text: Don’t worry. I know a little trick Harry Houdini used to do. She starts working at the lock of her handcuffs with the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phoenix is still bashing against the door. The wood start splinter. Meanwhile, Paddington has made his way to the far end of ladder, but still can’t quite reach Mary. And just then, Phoenix breaks through door. He hits the RETRACT BUTTON on the EXTENDABLE LADDER. Paddington is PULLED BACK INTO HIS ARMS.  177 178 179 180 Post Additional Photography Draft 2 - 06.08.17 104. Phoenix grabs the BOOK, hurls Paddington into the rear tr and BOLTS THE DOOR, trapping him inside the last truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phoenix PULLS THE PIN between the two trucks, SEPARATING PADDINGTON’S FROM THE REST OF THE TRAIN.

dialogues.speaker: PHOENIX
dialogues.text: Bye bye, bear. He leans out and uses the pin to knock a TRACK-SIDE LEVER The POINTS SHIFT, sending Paddington’s truck hurtling ont different track. Phoenix turns back inside but stops in his tracks, standi in the middle of four COCONUTS ON STANDS. We crash zoom as he sees the Browns have escaped from the handcuffs and stand at the far end of the next truck. Judy takes a photograph, while Henry picks up a coconut s ball, and throws it. It travels through clean the two trucks and connects with PHOENIX’S FOREHEAD - knocking him cold.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Bullseye!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PADDINGTON’S TRUCK has left the main railway line and is hurtling through a siding. He is thrown around as it CRASHES THROUGH THE BUFFERS at end of the siding. It HURTLES DOWN A SLOPE, crashing through foliage, over a cliff and into the murky waters of a river below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. PULLMAN DRIVER’S CAB - DAY Mary has seen the disaster from their cab.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Stop the train, Jonathan. Jonathan PULLS THE BRAKE LEVER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pullman SHRIEKS TO A HALT on a viaduct.  Post Additional Photography Draft 2 - 06.08.17 105.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paddington’s truck is SINKING INTO THE RIVER. He tries to open the door - but it won't give.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary jumps off the train.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Jonathan. Go and get help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paddington heaves, but the door still won’t give, and the carriage is filling with water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary runs to the side of the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The Runaway Truck lands at the bottom of the river.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary pulls off her coat and DIVES INTO THE WATER.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Mary cuts through the water, swimming down towards the tr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FEW INCHES OF AIR have been trapped towards the top of truck, but they’re DISAPPEARING FAST. Paddington hears a METALLIC NOISE from the other side of door as Mary works the lock from the outside. He TAKES A FINAL BREATH and sinks under the water.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Mary has UNBOLTED THE DOOR. She HEAVES IT OPEN, inch by i She can see Paddington’s face through the crack in the do  190 Post Additional Photography Draft 2 - 06.08.17 106. But then the door STOPS MOVING. Mary looks frantically around for the problem. She sees that the door has been CHAINED SHUT. Mary and Paddington TUG AT THE CHAIN TOGETHER with all th might - but it's no good. The chain is just too strong. Paddington reaches through the gap in the doorway and TAK MARY'S HAND WITH HIS PAW. They gaze at each other, knowing the end is upon him. But suddenly... a shadow crosses his eyes. He looks up to see the silhouette of a SEAPLANE LANDING O

dialogues.speaker: THE WATER ABOVE THEM
dialogues.text: He can hear distant voices. There are three splashes as people dive in. And then... SOMEONE ELSE IS AT THE DOOR! It’s KNUCKLES! Phibs and Spoon follow in his wake. Together, they ALL PULL AT THE DOORS. And slowly, inexorably, the CHAIN BREAKS. Mary grabs Paddington and pulls him towards the surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary, Knuckles and Paddington surface, gasping for breath

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON
dialogues.text: Knuckles! You came back!

dialogues.speaker: KNUCKLES
dialogues.text: Can’t make marmalade on my own, now, can I? Paddington smiles - and then passes out.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Paddington? He’s burning up.

dialogues.speaker: KNUCKLES
