dialogues.text: Best get the little fella to bed. They climb out of the water as Henry, Jonathan, Judy and Bird appear on the bank.  Post Additional Photography Draft 2 - 06.08.17 107.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Mary!

dialogues.speaker: JUDY
dialogues.text: Mum!

dialogues.speaker: JOANTHAN
dialogues.text: Paddington!

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: He’s not well.

dialogues.speaker: KNUCKLES
dialogues.text: He'll be fine. Won’t you, little buddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snow falls in the street. The camera cranes up towards Paddington’s attic window and through into his room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paddington lies asleep in bed, surrounded by the family. Bird is taking his temperature. As she removes the thermometer from his mouth, his eyelid flutter and he wakes up.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Paddington!

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON
dialogues.text: Where am I?

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Take it easy, now.

dialogues.speaker: MRS BIRD
dialogues.text: You gave us a wee scare, but you’re home now. Paddington’s face lights up.

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON
dialogues.text: Home?

dialogues.speaker: JUDY
dialogues.text: That's right. Look! Judy hands him a newspaper: “EXCLUSIVE! PADDINGTON FREED! Food Actor Arrested.”

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: The police realised they’d made a terrible mistake.  193 Post Additional Photography Draft 2 - 06.08.17 108.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Phoenix Buchanan has been arrested and, I might add, is no longer a member of our Platinum Club.

dialogues.speaker: MRS BIRD
dialogues.text: You're a free bear.

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON
dialogues.text: How long have I been asleep?!

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Three days!

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON
dialogues.text: Three days? But that means...

dialogues.speaker: JUDY
dialogues.text: It’s Aunt Lucy’s birthday. A little spark goes out in Paddington’s eyes.

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON
dialogues.text: Oh. And I never sent anything.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: It’s alright, Paddington.

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON
dialogues.text: But it isn’t alright Mrs Brown. Aunt Lucy did so much for me when I was a cub - and all I ever really wanted to do was to make her proud. But now she’s going to wake up on her birthday with no present and think I’ve let her down completely.

dialogues.speaker: MRS BIRD
dialogues.text: Och you great goose, she won’t think that at all!

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON
dialogues.text: Won’t she?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Come with us. He takes Paddington by the paw and leads him downstairs. INT. THE BROWNS’ STAIRCASE - CONTINUOUS Paddington looks over the banisters to see the hallway is full of people. It seems like the whole neighbourhood has come to wish him well.

dialogues.speaker: MR GRUBER
dialogues.text: He’s here!  Post Additional Photography Draft 2 - 06.08.17 109. The neighbours erupt into cheers and applause.

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON
dialogues.text: What are you all doing here?

dialogues.speaker: MISS KITTS
dialogues.text: We wanted to say thank you.

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON
dialogues.text: Thank you?

dialogues.speaker: MS PETERS
dialogues.text: For everything you’ve done for us.

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON
dialogues.text: Me? The crowd agree.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL
dialogues.text: If it wasn’t for you, we'd never have met.

dialogues.speaker: BIN MAN
dialogues.text: You helped me pass my exams.

dialogues.speaker: DR JAFRI
dialogues.text: And I would be permanently locked out of my house. The crowd laugh - but all Paddington can think is how ama he is that he means so much to them.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: I’d say you’ve rather a lot to be proud of.

dialogues.speaker: MR GRUBER
dialogues.text: When we heard the police needed the book as evidence we thought we’d get Aunt Lucy another present.

dialogues.speaker: DR JAFRI
dialogues.text: We all clubbed together.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL
dialogues.text: I pulled in a few favours from my old air force buddies.

dialogues.speaker: CYCLIST
dialogues.text: And we think she’s going to love it. Paddington looks baffled.

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON
dialogues.text: But... what is it?  Post Additional Photography Draft 2 - 06.08.17 110.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: You wanted to get that book so Aunt Lucy could see London, didn’t you?

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON
dialogues.text: It was always her dream.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Well we thought, why look at London in a book, when she could see the real thing? Just then, the DOORBELL RINGS. Paddington looks up at Mar not daring to believe.

dialogues.speaker: MARY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why don't you go and answer it? Paddington goes to the front door and opens it. And there, standing in the snow, is Aunt Lucy. The Young Bear’s face lights up in perfect joy. He flies into her arms and nuzzles against her.

dialogues.speaker: AUNT LUCY
dialogues.text: Oh, Paddington.

dialogues.speaker: PADDINGTON
dialogues.text: Happy birthday, Aunt Lucy. In Paddington’s eyes, we see his happiness is complete. THE END.  194 195 Post Additional Photography Draft 2 - 06.08.17 111. CREDITS. As the credits roll, PADDINGTON’S SCRAP BOOK appears on screen. As the PAGES TURN, we discover what happened next - Paddington and Aunt Lucy toured London, their journey commemorated with snapshots and ticket stubs: Mammal Mia, Bearfoot in the Park, The Winter’s Tail. - Knuckles, Phibs and Spoon were paroled. The Portobello Express notes that the Judge described them as changed me They plan to open a cafe called “Knuckles’ Sandwiches”. - Mary swam the channel. But she forgot her passport and to swim back again. - Jonathan gave up the name J-Dog and started the Steam T which proved surprisingly popular among his classmates. - Henry finally got his promotion, having proved that he not too old for anything. - A final newspaper headline in the scrapbook announces ‘PHOENIX BUCHANAN SENTENCED TODAY.’ Under the headline is picture of the JUDGE, which comes to life...

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE
dialogues.text: Phoenix Buchanan you have proved yourself a heinous criminal. Phoenix whimpers.

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And a disgrace to the noble profession of acting. Phoenix howls with self pity.

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I hereby sentence you to ten years in prison - and suggest you use your time behind bars wisely. As Phoenix listens to these words, a change comes over hi

dialogues.speaker: PHOENIX
dialogues.text: I shall your honour. I shall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A caption reads SIX MONTHS LATER.  Post Additional Photography Draft 2 - 06.08.17 112.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phoenix is in prison, performing an EXTRAVAGANT MUSICAL version of “RAIN ON THE ROOF”. But instead of performing his own, he now is part of a company with the other inmat They finish the routine and the prison crowd go wild.

dialogues.speaker: PHOENIX
dialogues.text: Thank you my darlings, thank you. It seems I didn’t need the West End at all, just a captive audience. The crowd laugh at his terrible joke.

dialogues.speaker: PHOENIX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Honestly, what am I like? Guards, lock me up! Oh wait, you have!
